title: Quotes website (non-famous people) — frontend feed, submission, browsing, and theme

requirements.summary: Build a quotes home feed and a quote submission form with React Query loading/error states and automatic refetch after submit.
acceptanceCriteria: Home page displays a scrollable list/feed of quotes with quote text and author name.
A “Submit a quote” flow exists with a form for quote text and author name and a submit button.
After successful submission, the new quote appears in the feed without requiring a manual refresh (React Query invalidation/refetch).
Loading and error states are shown for both listing and submission.

file_operations.description: Create the main App component that renders the quotes feed view, header, and submission form in a single-page layout (no extra routes unless needed).
Implement the home feed page container that composes search/sort controls, the scrollable feed, and the submission flow.
Create a feed component that renders a scrollable list of quote items and handles empty state, loading skeleton/placeholder, and error UI.
Create a quote display component with clear typography hierarchy (quote text vs author) and consistent spacing aligned to the site theme.
Create a submission form with inputs for quote text and author name, client-side validation for non-empty values, submit button, and submission loading/error/success feedback.
Add React Query hooks for listing quotes and submitting a quote, including query invalidation/refetch on successful submission.
Add a small frontend client wrapper around the existing backend connection to call quote-related backend capabilities (list and create), isolating canister method details from UI components.
Fix styling import to use the existing global Tailwind stylesheet (import the correct file location) and ensure the new App component is correctly imported and rendered.

requirements.summary: Add client-side browsing utilities: case-insensitive search across quote text/author and simple sorting (Newest/Oldest).
acceptanceCriteria: Frontend provides a search input that filters quotes by matching quote text or author name (case-insensitive).
Frontend provides a sort control with at least: Newest first and Oldest first.
Backend supports listing with optional query parameters needed to implement search and sorting efficiently (or frontend filtering if dataset is small), with documented behavior in code comments.

file_operations.description: Add search input state and sort control state; wire them to the feed rendering so filtering is case-insensitive over quote text/author name and sorting supports Newest first / Oldest first.
Create a toolbar component that contains the search input and sort control (and any small helper text), designed to match the reading-focused theme.
Support passing search/sort parameters into the listing query key so React Query caching behaves correctly when users change search/sort.

Document (in code comments) whether filtering/sorting is performed client-side due to small dataset assumptions or supported by backend listing capabilities when available; keep behavior deterministic and well-defined.

requirements.summary: Apply a warm, paper-like visual theme (no blue/purple primary) with readable typography and consistent component styling across the app using Tailwind.
acceptanceCriteria: UI uses a consistent theme (e.g., warm paper-like background, ink-like text, accent color) across all pages/components.
Typography emphasizes readability for quote text (clear hierarchy between quote text and author name).
Theme is applied consistently to feed items, buttons, inputs, and headers using Tailwind + existing UI components (without editing immutable component source files).

file_operations.description: Update CSS variables/Tailwind base layer to a warm neutral palette (paper background, ink foreground, warm accent) and tune base typography defaults for readability; avoid blue/purple as primary.
Apply the global layout styling (max width, comfortable spacing, header + content structure) and ensure all text is in English.
Refine typography (larger quote text, subdued author line), spacing, and subtle borders/shadows to match the paper/ink theme.
Ensure form fields/buttons follow the theme (warm accents, consistent focus/hover states) using Tailwind classes and/or existing UI components where available (do not edit immutable UI sources).

requirements.summary: Wire static generated branding images (logo and paper texture) into the UI from frontend/public/assets/generated.
acceptanceCriteria: Generated images are placed in frontend/public/assets/generated and referenced directly by the frontend (no backend routing).
Site displays the logo in the header and uses the background/texture in a visually subtle way (e.g., hero or page background).

file_operations.description: Add the generated logo asset at frontend/public/assets/generated/quotes-logo.dim_512x512.png so it can be referenced statically by the frontend.
Add the generated background texture asset at frontend/public/assets/generated/paper-texture.dim_1600x900.png so it can be referenced statically by the frontend.
Create a header that displays the logo from frontend/public/assets/generated/quotes-logo.dim_512x512.png and the site title; keep it lightweight and consistent with the theme.

Wire the SiteHeader into the app layout and apply a subtle background treatment using frontend/public/assets/generated/paper-texture.dim_1600x900.png (e.g., page background layer) without adding backend routing.
